isis.stitle: GENERAL INSTRUMENT ELECTRONIC PROGRAMMABLE SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER - TEST 7 - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER UNIT SELF DIAGNOSTICS

svcprocinfo.para: This test includes more complete self-test diagnostics than are performed in TEST 1. The speedometer/tachometer unit contains (4) serviceable (replaceable) components: the housing (includes the printed circuit board), the speedometer, tachometer and odometer ( Figure 8). This test will determine which component(s) is defective and can be replaced without replacing the complete speedometer/tachometer unit.

svcsubproc.title: Prior To Performing The Diagnostics Process:

step1.para:
The speedometer/tachometer unit must be removed from the instrument panel to perform this test and all connections to vehicle wire harness disconnected (
REMOVE AND INSTALL).

important.para: Write Down All Dip Switch Positions On The Speedometer/Tachometer Unit. The Positions Will Be Either "1" Or "0" For Each Switch ( Figure 19). There Are (2) Sets Of (10) Switches. Verify That They Are Recorded Correctly Before Going On To Next Step.

step1.para: Set ALL DIP SWITCHES to the "0" position. If they are not set to "0" the following will occur:
Odometer will not increment.
The gauge pointer(s) will rotate up-scale and remain there on a gauge with a faulty DIP switch or one that the DIP switch was not set at "0".
Attach the Cluster Test Harness to the speedometer/tachometer unit ( Figure 20). DO NOT PLUG INTO POWER SOURCE AT THIS TIME!

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. CLUSTER DATA LINK CONNECTOR TO MATING TEST HARNESS CONNECTOR
3. CONNECT CLUSTER TACHOMETER SENSOR CONNECTOR TO MATING CONNECTOR (HAS (1) FEMALE TERMINAL)
5. CONNECT CLUSTER SPEEDOMETER CONNECTOR TO MATING CONNECTOR (HAS (3) FEMALE TERMINALS)
7. CONNECT CLUSTER TWO SPEED CONNECTOR TO MATING CONNECTOR (MUST BE CONNECTED EVEN IF THE VEHICLE DOES NOT HAVE 2-SPEED AXLE)

step1.para:
Figure 21 is a circuit diagram of the Cluster Test Harness. Refer to
SPECIAL TOOLS for part number.

svcsubproc.title: Performing The Diagnostic Test:

step1.para: To begin the diagnostic test requires that your depress the MOMENTARY PUSH SWITCH repeatedly (at least 3 times) as rapidly as possible IMMEDIATELY (within 1 second) after inserting the POWER PLUG into the cigar lighter.
If the cluster is not defective, the speedometer and tachometer pointers will:

step2.para: Rotate in unison to the "0" position on the gauge face.
Both pointers will then rotate in unison up-scale in ten equal steps to full scale (85 mph/3500 RPM).
Both pointers will then rotate in unison down-scale back to the "0" position.
As the speedometer and tachometer gauge pointers advance 10 steps in sequence b. above the odometer will advance .1 mile for each of the 10 steps (1 mile up and then 1 mile down).
The diagnostic process will continue to cycle as described until power is removed.

step1.para: If during the test, the speedometer or tachometer pointers or the odometer do operate through the range as described above in Step 2:

step2.para: Remove power and restart the test as instructed in Step 1 to be certain that the start-up process was done properly. If after rerunning the test the speedometer, tachometer or odometer do not operate as described in Step 2 review the following defective performance indicators.

svcsubproc.para: If more than one of the 3 meters fails to properly move through the described range of movement in Diagnostic Test, Step 2 replace the unit housing.
ANALYZING SPEEDOMETER PERFORMANCE DURING TEST CYCLE

step1.para: TACHOMETER POINTER advances correctly as described in Performing Diagnostic Test, Step 2.
ODOMETER increments properly as described in Performing Diagnostic Test, Step 2.
SPEEDOMETER pointer is DEAD STILL or does not go through correct range of actions described in Performing Diagnostic Test, Step 2.

Remove speedometer/tachometer unit face plate (see
REMOVE AND INSTALL) and switch the speedometer and tachometer gauges in the unit and rerun the diagnostic test.
If the speedometer gauge operates properly in the tachometer position and the tachometer doesn't operate properly in the speedometer position REPLACE the unit housing and retest to verify.
If the Speedometer doesn't operate properly in the tachometer position BUT the tachometer operates in the speedometer position, REPLACE the speedometer gauge and retest to verify.

svcsubproc.para: If during diagnostic the test cycle:

step1.para: SPEEDOMETER POINTER advances correctly as described in Performing Diagnostic Test, Step 2.
ODOMETER increments properly as described in Performing Diagnostic Test, Step 2.
TACHOMETER pointer is DEAD STILL or does not go through correct range of actions described in Performing Diagnostic Test, Step 2.

Remove speedometer/tachometer unit face plate (see
REMOVE AND INSTALL) and switch the speedometer and tachometer gauges in the unit and rerun the diagnostic test.
If the tachometer gauge operates properly in the speedometer position and the tachometer doesn't operate properly in the speedometer position REPLACE the unit housing and retest to verify.
If the tachometer doesn't operate properly in the speedometer position BUT the speedometer operates in the tachometer position, REPLACE the tachometer gauge and retest to verify.

svcsubproc.para: If during diagnostic the test cycle:

step1.para: SPEEDOMETER POINTER advances correctly as described in Performing Diagnostic Test, Step 2.
TACHOMETER POINTER advances correctly as described in Performing Diagnostic Test, Step 2.
ODOMETER does not increment properly as described in Performing Diagnostic Test, Step 2.
Remove odometer from speedometer/tachometer unit.
MOMENTARILY apply 12 volt DC power across odometer leads. Each time power is applied, the odometer should increment.

step2.para: If the odometer increments with power applied, REPLACE the speedometer/tachometer housing and retest to verify.
If the odometer does not increment, REPLACE the odometer and retest to verify.

step1.para: If during the Diagnostic Test the speedometer AND tachometer gauge pointers both only go to 2/3 scale simultaneously, and the odometer increments with each sweep, then there is a problem with the ATA data link circuitry. REPLACE the housing.
